questions.explanation: Muharram is the first month and one of the four sacred months.

questions.text: Which surah begins with 'By the fig and the olive'?
questions.explanation: Surah At-Teen (95) starts with oaths by the fig and olive.

questions.text: Who was the first martyr (shaheed) in Islam?
questions.explanation: Sumayyah (RA) was killed by Abu Jahl for accepting Islam.

questions.text: Which animal carried the Prophet (SAW) during Mi'raj?
questions.explanation: Buraq was a heavenly mount faster than lightning.

questions.text: How many times is the word 'Allah' mentioned in the Qur’an?
questions.explanation: The name 'Allah' appears 2698 times in the Qur’an.

questions.text: Which prophet is mentioned most frequently in the Qur’an?
questions.explanation: Prophet Musa (AS) is mentioned 136 times.

questions.text: What is the greatest verse (Ayat al-Kursi) found in which surah?
questions.explanation: Ayat al-Kursi is verse 255 of Surah Al-Baqarah.

questions.text: Which companion was known as 'The Lion of Allah' (Asadullah)?
questions.explanation: Hamza (RA) was given this title by the Prophet (SAW).

questions.text: Which treaty ended the state of war between Muslims and Quraysh?
questions.explanation: Signed in 6 AH, it was a 10-year peace treaty.

questions.text: Which surah is recited in every rak’ah of salah?
questions.explanation: Surah Al-Fatiha is obligatory in every rak’ah.

questions.text: What is the meaning of 'Zakat'?
questions.explanation: Zakat means both purification and growth.

questions.text: How many prophets are mentioned by name in the Qur’an?
questions.explanation: 25 prophets are explicitly named, including Adam, Nuh, Ibrahim, Musa, Isa, and Muhammad (peace be upon them all).

questions.text: Which city was the first capital of the Islamic state?
questions.explanation: Madinah became the capital after the Hijrah in 622 CE.

questions.text: What is the night of Laylat al-Qadr better than?
questions.explanation: Laylat al-Qadr is better than a thousand months (Qur’an 97:3).

questions.text: Which companion memorized the entire Qur’an during the Prophet’s lifetime?
questions.explanation: Many companions (Huffaz) memorized the full Qur’an while the Prophet was alive.

questions.text: What is the Arabic word for 'pilgrimage'?
questions.explanation: Hajj is the fifth pillar performed in Dhul-Hijjah.

questions.text: Which prophet spoke as a newborn baby?
questions.explanation: Prophet Isa (Jesus) spoke from the cradle to defend his mother Maryam.

questions.text: What is the meaning of 'SAW' we say after the Prophet’s name?
questions.explanation: Sallallahu Alayhi Wasallam means 'Peace and blessings be upon him'.

questions.text: Which surah has the same number of verses as the number of surahs in the Qur’an?
questions.explanation: Surah An-Nas is the 114th surah and has 6 verses (but the question refers to its position).

questions.text: What is the reward for performing Hajj Mabrur (accepted Hajj)?
questions.explanation: The Prophet (SAW) said: 'There is no reward for accepted Hajj except Paradise.'

questions.text: Which companion was known as 'The Interpreter of the Qur’an'?
questions.explanation: Ibn Abbas (RA) was a young cousin of the Prophet and a great scholar of Tafsir.

questions.text: What is the last verse revealed of the Qur’an?
questions.explanation: Surah Al-Ma’idah 5:3 was revealed during the Farewell Hajj: 'This day I have perfected your religion…'

questions.text: Which prophet was swallowed by a whale?
questions.explanation: Prophet Yunus (Jonah) spent days inside a whale before being saved.

questions.text: What is the meaning of 'As-Salamu Alaikum'?
questions.explanation: The Islamic greeting of peace.

questions.text: Which surah is called 'Umm al-Kitab' (Mother of the Book)?
questions.explanation: Al-Fatiha is also called As-Sab’a al-Mathani and Umm al-Qur’an.

questions.text: How many years did Prophet Nuh (AS) preach to his people?
questions.explanation: Qur’an (29:14) states he stayed among them 950 years.

questions.text: What is the reward for fasting on the Day of Arafah (for non-pilgrims)?

options.text: Forgiveness of past and future minor sins

questions.explanation: Forgiveness of the previous year and the coming year.

questions.text: Which surah mentions the story of the People of the Cave (Ashab al-Kahf)?
questions.explanation: Surah Al-Kahf tells the story of youths who slept for centuries.

questions.text: What is the first word revealed of the Qur’an?
questions.explanation: The first word revealed was 'Iqra' (Read/Recite) in Cave Hira.

questions.text: Which prophet is known as 'Father of the Prophets'?
questions.explanation: Prophet Ibrahim (AS) is called Abu al-Anbiya (Father of the Prophets).
